&ltOBJECT>.MENUITEMCHECK() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.MENUITEMCHECK( Menu_Item as C, Check_Flag as L ) ArgumentDescription Menu_ItemThe text of a menu entry. Check_Flag .T. = Place checkmark.
.F. = Remove checkmark.
Description The &ltOBJECT>.MENUITEMCHECK() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.MENUITEMCHECK() method sets or removes the checkmark next to a menu entry in a menu loaded by a form or browse. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example The following example removes the checkmark from the Allow Edits entry in the Form menu. dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() ptr.MenuItemCheck("Allow Edits", .F.)
See Also Window Functions and Methods, <OBJECT>.MENUITEMENABLE(), <OBJECT>.MENUITEMRESET()
